articles.headline: Jittery Markets Make the Most of Good News
articles.snippet: Stocks surged on Monday after last-minute negotiations salvaged the rescue of Bear Stearns and housing sales snapped a long streak of declines.
articles.abstract: Stocks surged on Monday after last-minute negotiations salvaged the rescue of Bear Stearns and housing sales snapped a long streak of declines.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wall Street appears to be developing a case of whiplash.

articles.headline: Small Firms Find Credit Is Tightening
articles.snippet: The Small Business Administration has not said publicly that it is worried about a credit squeeze but signs point to a decline in business loans through its main program.
articles.abstract: The Small Business Administration has not said publicly that it is worried about a credit squeeze but signs point to a decline in business loans through its main program.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lenders’ credit woes are starting to take a toll on small businesses.

articles.headline: Seeking Fast Deal, JPMorgan Quintuples Bear Stearns Bid
articles.snippet: JPMorgan’s improved offer illustrates the deep complexity and political sensitivity of the deal, which also met the rejection and anger of Bear Stearns shareholders and employees.
articles.abstract: JPMorgan’s improved offer illustrates the deep complexity and political sensitivity of the deal, which also met the rejection and anger of Bear Stearns shareholders and employees.
articles.lead_paragraph: Confronting a crowd of furious Bear Stearns executives last week, James Dimon’s temper suddenly flared. Pounding the table, his voice rising in anger, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase defended the $2-a-share price he had struck for Bear Stearns as well as the government’s support of the deal.
articles.byline: By Landon Thomas Jr. and Eric Dash

articles.headline: Obama’s Test: Can a Liberal Be a Unifier?
articles.snippet: Barack Obama’s candidacy challenges the idea that a majority coalition must be carefully centrist.
articles.abstract: Barack Obama’s candidacy challenges the idea that a majority coalition must be carefully centrist.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  At the core of Senator Barack Obama’s presidential campaign is a promise that he can transcend the starkly red-and-blue politics of the last 15 years, end the partisan and ideological wars and build a new governing majority.

articles.headline: TB Patients Chafe Under Lockdown in South Africa
articles.snippet: South Africa is trying to balance the liberty of patients with tuberculosis against the need to protect society.
articles.abstract: South Africa is trying to balance the liberty of patients with tuberculosis against the need to protect society.
articles.lead_paragraph: PORT ELIZABETH, South Africa  The Jose Pearson TB Hospital here is like a prison for the sick. It is encircled by three fences topped with coils of razor wire to keep patients infected with lethal strains of tuberculosis from escaping.

articles.headline: Justice Dept. Approves XM Merger With Sirius
articles.snippet: The Justice Department said the buyout of XM Satellite Radio by Sirius would not hurt competition or consumers.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department said the buyout of XM Satellite Radio by Sirius would not hurt competition or consumers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department gave approval on Monday to the merger of two rival radio networks, XM and Sirius, a marriage that would create a de facto monopoly in satellite services now used by more than 17 million subscribers.

articles.headline: Six of the Fallen, in Words They Sent Home
articles.snippet: Unlike soldiers of previous wars, who were only occasionally able to write letters, many who served and died in Iraq left behind an extraordinary electronic testimony.
articles.abstract: Unlike soldiers of previous wars, who were only occasionally able to write letters, many who served and died in Iraq left behind an extraordinary electronic testimony.
articles.lead_paragraph: By the time Specialist Jerry Ryen King decided to write about his experiences in Iraq, the teenage paratrooper had more to share than most other soldiers.
articles.byline: By Lizette Alvarez and Andrew W. Lehren

articles.headline: One Drug, Two Faces
articles.snippet: Alaska has brought a suit against Eli Lilly accusing the company of hiding the side effects of its bestselling schizophrenia medicine, Zyprexa.
articles.abstract: Alaska has brought a suit against Eli Lilly accusing the company of hiding the side effects of its bestselling schizophrenia medicine, Zyprexa.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANCHORAGE  Two courtrooms, two floors of the Nesbett Courthouse, two views of Zyprexa.

articles.headline: Behind the Deal, the Hand of the Fed
articles.snippet: JPMorgan’s move to raise its bid on Bear Stearns exposes what no one dared to say aloud: the Federal Reserve is officially in the deal-making business.
articles.abstract: JPMorgan’s move to raise its bid on Bear Stearns exposes what no one dared to say aloud: the Federal Reserve is officially in the deal-making business.
articles.lead_paragraph: Adam Smith’s invisible hand has a puppeteer: the Federal Reserve.
